title: Should we ever expect another big cinematic battle like "A New Dawn" in the future?
body:
It seems like all of Riot's recent cinematics have been 30-second stints for new Champions like Aurelion Sol, Vel'koz, etc, or cinematics devoted to Esports. But A New Dawn was simply awesome, and it'd be great to see another battle cinematic at some point.

After all, Riot's gonna have to step up its cinematic game to have a chance of competing with Blizzard's Overwatch cinematics. Seriously, "Alive" and "Recall" were like Pixar mini-films, and I loved them.

replies.body:
What up, Yousosmart.

I'm TreblMuffin, I'm the sound bro working with our cinematics teams.

I obviously wouldn't be able to speak to the overarching strategy of them, so the following is basically my take on the whole thing. You have to remember that cinematics are often only a _piece_ of the story we tell when a champion is released, and that sometimes a piece is all we want you to have because that can actually show you who a champ is _better_. Follow me down this path...

So take a look at a champion like Jhin. He was really really hard to deal with. How do you show players how completely messed up that guy is? Well... that's the thing... to Jhin, the horrifying parts of life are beautiful. So we wanted to show that. We wanted to abstract death for players in the same way that he abstracts it for himself. We made something enigmatic, beautiful, but just a little bit eerie.

While A New Dawn is flipping awesome, I don't think it's tremendously compelling from a narrative point of view. It's just a really _really_ cool fight.

Now personally, I would really like to see longer, more breathy narrative cinematics with all of that awesome depth of story and action I'm hungry for. Maybe someday, maybe not. But we're always going to work as hard as we can to make sure when something drops, it's a compelling piece of art. Let us know if we ever miss the mark for you, we're always hunting for these kinds of posts!

I feel like you missed the point of what this post was trying to make.  He wasn't harping on the short cinematics that you guys do.  He was simply wondering if something like the longer ones would ever pop up again.  By all means, continue to do the short ones.  I love them.  What is being asked is will there ever be another one of the long ones.  Don't go all "narrative" and read too much into a simple post asking for something that many in the community thought was super freakin awesome!!!  We really enjoyed that cinematic and it would be great to get something like that at least once a year.  :)

Edit: It would also be cool to see longer cinematics where you brought your lore to life.

You have an excellent point, and I wasn't too clear. Sometimes my thinky brain kicks in without me setting the context in my posts. All my bad :)

I understand what the OP's question was, but rather than just a "maybe," I thought a more substantial answer would be more fun; trying to address some of the reasons why I think we've made the creative choices we've made and _not_ made another A New Dawn.

And totally agree, the big ol battle in A New Dawn is nuts. Sharjo actually put it better than I did:

> I prefer the cinematics that focus on individual champions than big battle mash up cinematics because one actually has story implications, while the other is just for funsies. Nothing wrong with fun cinematics, I just prefer the former in this case.

This! I also enjoy seeing how the champions interact even when forced into teams; makes them feel alive.
The single champion lore flashbacks they've been doing just feel like a failed screensaver.
I'm the Re-recording Mixer! I don't create the music, that job goes to our music team. I just make sure that once it gets into the video it gels with all the other elements.

will we ever get a Freljord cinematic? I would really want to see one since the whole place is set for war. It would also be quite interesting to see a Piltover cinematic. It would be nice to see what life is like there. I think it would be good to see the daily life of the Sheriff. Because that way, we can see every part of Piltover because she roams the whole city, maybe even part of Zaun. I can totally see her grabbing a Sumpsnipe by the collar and hauling him to the Wardens.

> Even though the fight cinematics aren't tied to lore, i loved the glimpses of personality we saw in the New Dawn one. Moments like Leona sacrificing herself for Ahri, Graves' quick thinking against Nautilus, Draven shoving his way past his ally Zyra to throw his axe. I guess i like how cinematics like that give us the interactions between champs whereas the new champion teasers don't really do that. It would have been cool to see a Taliyah teaser video with yasuo in it (even tho i know she is supposed to be the focus) just to see the relationship between the two. In the future, I can definitely see a frejilord cinematic that is like the New Dawn one but with lore in it!
> 
 
> Side Note: The New Dawn Cinematic was the first LoL video i ever saw and was the reason i started playing league.

The best glimpse of personality was Grave's eyebrow raise/ headshake after Rengar brutalized Draven.  To me, "A New Dawn" was more "Graves Is Awesome".
Yes! Don't forget when he had his gun pointed right at Katarina's face lol This is why we need more cinematics like that ":0

What if you guys created short cinematics based on what region you plan on working on next, that involved the lore, revealing of perhaps a new champion or remodel/rework of a champion, and ultimately reinforced the feel players should have when envisioning that area.

For example, if you guys ever do a massive project involving all the Ionian characters, you could create short cinematics where they all are interspersed within each other's lives, and then it might show off future champs as well or reworked champs (Karma for example <333333333333333 #bringbackthefans2016). 

I think this could potentially be the best way to represent a champions lore and their personality while simultaneously engaging the player and making them want to start using said champion/champions.

What if, instead of a battle sequence, League could have a season based cinematic to kick off the new year? I kind of like the idea of seeing what pre-season brings to the new year and think it could benefit new players or players coming back as opposed to trying to approach it from the narrative angle.

I know this is typically done in a patch review/youtube walkthrough format but it would be cool to see a cinematic showing all the effort you guys have put in to improvements etc. (and I don't mean dev camera interviews...more along the lines of a cinematic showing warwick fight the new rift herald, etc.)

And that's all well and good that short, individual champ cinematics are your primary focus.  They are very well done and great teasers that tie into lore.  

BUT, I would also like you to take into account the feedback you get from the bigger cinematics and really ask yourself, "why aren't we rolling at least one of these out per year"?  They are an extremely cool depiction of what the Rift would look like from a different animation perspective.  Giving that level of cinematics to something that many people play on a daily basis is just great to see.

Don't anyone know that there actually is another longer cinematic "A Twist of Fate" similar to "A New Dawn"... 

Also I'd love to see longer cinematics about champions lore and background, League of Legends is so much more than a game, it's a story. There should be something like a books or animated series of it, to get the whole full story out! For example I love the story between Nasus and Renekton, but the context is too thin..

{{champion:75}}  {{champion:58}}  - UP AND OUT!
30 minute television series style cinematics with the gfx animations of a new dawn would be freaking sweet. (Thinking back to the shurima event cinematics being comic book style).

Maybe future cinematics could involve some story development for champions, like Aurelion Sol breaking free from Targon's influence, or maybe what happened when Zed entered the Ionian temple with his old master?

I think the Jinx music video is a good example of how you can make longer cinematics that are enjoyable and fun to watch, while also giving you a clear idea of the type of person the champion in question is. So I'm not entirely convinced the only way to tell a portion of a story is to keep it short.

I think you're reading into this a bit too much...

All the OP wants (and some community as well) is an awesome cinematic of a battle between champions. Like it doesn't have to do anything with lore- a new dawn didn't -all it showed was 2 teams of champions fighting it out. We want another cinematic like that where we just see awesome animation between 2 teams of champions. It doesn't need to have lore attached to it, we just want a movie fight lol.

By all means though, keep doing the 30s lore videos, but everyones wondering if another cinematic like a new dawn is coming out so we can watch some awesome 5v5 action between teams and champions.

None of the animations have been particularly compelling from a narrative point of view, though? 

I mean, aside from the 'Cass stabbing Sivir in the back' one, they've basically all just been tiny stuff that exist to show off the champion. You get the same basic impact just by reading their lore.

Hell, for Amumu and Kalista, you get the exact same impact, since their animations are just their lore animated, really!

I feel like League doesn't know what it wants to be anymore in regards to cinematics. 

The lore retcon destroyed the IOW and summoners with it making big battle cinematics like A New Dawn seem out of place lore-wise. 

Now every new champion is getting a small art teaser with some lore attached (sometimes). While plenty of older champions no longer make sense or even League of Legends in general for that matter.

We have virtually no old lore and very small amounts of new lore. This leaves us in a grey area where nothing really seems to matter because it never fully connects the champions with the entire game or its purpose for taking place.
